location_description: Warehouse with high shelving and active forklift operations

hazards.description: A forklift is operating in reverse in an active warehouse area without an audible reverse alarm. A pedestrian is walking directly into the path of the reversing forklift, creating an immediate risk of collision.
recommended_actions: Ensure all forklifts are equipped with fully functional audible reverse alarms and implement a routine inspection schedule for these safety features.
Establish and clearly mark dedicated pedestrian walkways and forklift operating zones to minimize interaction.
Conduct comprehensive safety training for all personnel on pedestrian safety protocols, emphasizing awareness of moving equipment and maintaining safe distances.

hazards.description: The forklift is reversing with a large, vision-obstructing load, and the operator's view is further limited by only checking one mirror. There is no spotter present to guide the operator or alert them to the pedestrian in the blind spot.
recommended_actions: Implement a mandatory spotter policy for all forklift operations where the operator's view is obstructed by the load or other factors, especially during reversing.

Provide advanced training to forklift operators on blind spot awareness, proper use of all mirrors, and techniques for maintaining full situational awareness, including looking over both shoulders when reversing.
Consider installing additional safety devices such as wide-angle mirrors, proximity sensors, or camera systems on forklifts to enhance operator visibility and blind spot detection.

hazards.description: A pedestrian is walking in an active forklift operating area, directly into the path of a reversing forklift, without apparent awareness of the immediate danger.
recommended_actions: Implement clear pedestrian walkways and designated forklift operating zones.
Train all personnel on pedestrian safety protocols in areas with moving equipment, emphasizing vigilance and awareness of surroundings.
Encourage workers to make eye contact with equipment operators and to never assume they have been seen.
